com.marklogic.hub

Interface DataHub

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataHubImpl

    public interface DataHub
    Handles creation and orchastration of DHF with a MarkLogic server. Includes installs, version validation, updates, and the init of a DHF project.

    • Method Summary

        Determines if the data hub is installed in MarkLogic
        Returns:
        true if installed, false otherwise

      • isServerVersionValid

        boolean isServerVersionValid(java.lang.String versionString)
        Validates the MarkLogic server to ensure compatibility with the hub
        Parameters:
        versionString - - the version of the server to validate
        Returns:
        true if valid, false otherwise
        Throws:
        ServerValidationException - if the server is not compatible

        Initializes the project on disk, creates scaffold project code

        Removes user's modules from the modules db

      • runPreInstallCheck

        java.util.HashMap runPreInstallCheck()
        Runs the pre-install check for the datahub populating the object with variables necessary to perform the install. This is used for running install.

      • runPreInstallCheck

        java.util.HashMap runPreInstallCheck(Versions versions)
        Runs the pre-install check for the datahub populating the object with variables necessary to perform the install. This is used for running install.
        Parameters:
        versions - - the versions that the check is to be run against

        Installs the data hub configuration and server-side config files into MarkLogic

      • isSafeToInstall

        boolean isSafeToInstall()
        Checks to make sure all the versions and database in a valid configuration with version check
        Returns:
        boolean - if not, returns false, if safe to proceed ahead returns true

      • isPortInUse

        boolean isPortInUse(DatabaseKind kind)
        Checks to see if the port is in use
        Parameters:
        kind - - the DatabaseKind enum value (ex STAGING or JOB)
        Returns:
        true if the port is in use, false if it is not

      • setPortInUseBy

        void setPortInUseBy(DatabaseKind kind,
                    java.lang.String usedBy)
        Sets what appserver name is using the port
        Parameters:
        kind - - the DatabaseKind enum value (ex STAGING or JOB)
        usedBy - - string name of what is using the port

      • getPortInUseBy

        java.lang.String getPortInUseBy(DatabaseKind kind)
        Returns name of what is using the port
        Parameters:
        kind - - the DatabaseKind enum value (ex STAGING or JOB)
        Returns:
        name of who using the port

      • isServerVersionOk

        boolean isServerVersionOk()
        Checks to see if the datahub and server versions are compatible
        Returns:
        true if the server version matches, false if it does not

      • setServerVersionOk

        void setServerVersionOk(boolean serverVersionOk)
        Sets true or false if the server version is okay with this version of DHF
        Parameters:
        serverVersionOk - - true if it compatible or false if it is not

      • getServerVersion

        java.lang.String getServerVersion()
        Returns the string presentation of the server version, eg: "9.03-1"
        Returns:
        server version as a string, eg: "9.03-1"

      • setServerVersion

        void setServerVersion(java.lang.String serverVersion)
        Sets the server version holder on the datahub object - currently unused
        Parameters:
        serverVersion - - server version as a string, eg: "9.03-1"

      • upgradeHub

        boolean upgradeHub()
            throws CantUpgradeException
        Upgrades the installed datahub on the server to this version of the DataHub
        Returns:
        true or false based on success of the upgrade
        Throws:
        CantUpgradeException - - exception thrown when an upgrade can't happen

      • upgradeHub

        boolean upgradeHub(java.util.List<java.lang.String> updatedFlows)
            throws CantUpgradeException
        Upgrades the hub based on list of provided updated flows. All flows SHOULD be provided. The method without params will handle this automatically.
        Returns:
        boolean - false if upgrade fails for a reason other than an upgrade exception
        Throws:
        CantUpgradeException - - should the hub fail to upgrade for incompatibility reasons
